questions.question: I am sure he will never set the ……………………. on fire.
questions.description: To set the Thames on fire is to do something remarkable.

questions.question: The police suspect that he had a …………………….. in the plot.
questions.description: To have a hand in something is to be involved in it.

questions.question: Please do not take failure to ……………………..
questions.description: When you take something to heart, you are deeply affected by it.

questions.question: I am afraid you are burning the …………………….. at both ends.
questions.description: To burn the candle at both ends is to exhaust your energies.

questions.question: As a writer, Bernard Shaw was head and ………………………….. above his contemporaries.
questions.description: When you are head and shoulders above others, you are much better than them.

questions.question: The foolish man made ducks and ……………………… of his wealth.
questions.description: To make ducks and drakes of one’s wealth is to squander it.

questions.question: Although I have known her for a long time, she always gives me the cold …………………..
questions.description: To give someone the cold shoulder is to show unfriendliness.

questions.question: He is quite fond of blowing his own ……………………..
questions.description: To blow one’s own trumpet is to praise oneself.

questions.question: A spirit of unrest is in the ………………………….
questions.description: If something is in the air it is prevalent.

questions.question: I don’t think that you should accept that job. You already have too many ………………………. in the fire.
questions.description: To have too many irons in the fire is to be engaged in too many activities at the same time.

questions.question: I have a …………………… to pick with you.
questions.description: When you have a bone to pick with somebody, you have a reason to quarrel with them.

questions.question: All of his projects ended in …………………..
questions.description: To end in smoke is to come to nothing.
